But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# Vishay Intertechnology, Inc. (VSH) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Date of Report:** October 10, 2024 (based on real-time data as of this date)  
**Current Stock Price:** $22.22 (Yahoo Finance, Nasdaq close Oct 10, 2024)  
**Market Capitalization:** $3.03 billion (Yahoo Finance, as of Oct 10, 2024)  
**52-Week Range:** $20.46 - $27.74  

## Company Overview
Vishay Intertechnology, Inc. (NYSE: VSH), founded in 1962 and headquartered in Malvern, Pennsylvania, is a global leader in the design, manufacture, and distribution of discrete semiconductors and passive electronic components. The company operates through five segments: Metal Oxide Semiconductor Field-Effect Transistors (MOSFETs), Diodes, Optoelectronic Components, Resistors, and Inductors. Its portfolio serves diverse end-markets including automotive (e.g., EVs, ADAS), industrial (e.g., power supplies, motors), computing/consumer (e.g., smartphones, appliances), telecommunications/infrastructure (e.g., 5G base stations), and aerospace/defense/medical. With approximately 23,500 employees across 19 countries and manufacturing in Asia, Europe, and the Americas, Vishay generates over 50% of revenue from Asia (primarily China). In FY2023, it reported $3.4 billion in sales, emphasizing high-margin, custom, and harsh-environment products. Vishay differentiates via vertical integration, broad product breadth (over 50,000 SKUs), and innovation in silicon carbide (SiC) and power components amid electrification trends. Recent challenges include multi-year inventory destocking, but stabilization signals emerged in Q2 2024. (198 words)

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (Reported Aug 6, 2024):** Sales of $778.4 million (-11% YoY, -9% sequentially); GAAP net earnings $33.1 million ($0.24/share); adjusted EBITDA $143.8 million (18.5% margin). Automotive up 5% YoY; Industrial down 17%; book-to-bill 0.99 (Seeking Alpha transcript).
- **Q3 2024 Guidance (Aug 6, 2024):** Sales $740M-$770M (-8% to -2% YoY); adjusted EPS $0.14-$0.20, reflecting ongoing destocking but sequential improvement expected.
- **Inventory Trends (Aug 6, 2024 call):** Customer inventories peaked; destocking 80% complete in Industrial, 60% in Automotive; CEO Gerald Paul noted "stabilization in sight."
- **Product Launches (Sep 2024):** New SiC MOSFETs (1700V) for EV/renewables (Vishay press release Sep 10, 2024).
- **Dividend:** Quarterly $0.10/share declared Oct 8, 2024 (payable Oct 25); yield ~1.8%.
- **Other:** Sep 2024 investor presentation at Goldman Sachs Communacopia (Sep 12) reiterated recovery into 2025.

## Growth Strategy
- Focus on high-margin segments: Target 25%+ gross margins via premium products (e.g., SiC, thin-film resistors).
- Market expansion: Automotive (target 30%+ of sales by 2025, up from 26%); Industrial recovery via electrification.
- R&D investment: $120M+ annually (3.5% of sales); 1,200+ engineers on SiC/GaN/power semis.
- Capacity: Added 20% MOSFET capacity in 2024; Philippines expansion for passives (online Sep 2024).
- Share repurchases: $100M program (3% of market cap); repurchased $50M YTD.

## Company and Sector Headwinds/Tailwinds

| Category     | Headwinds                                                                 | Tailwinds                                                                 |
|--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Company** | Persistent destocking (Industrial/Auto); China exposure (35% sales, weak demand); margin pressure from underutilization (65% fab utilization Q2). | Pricing discipline (+2-3% YoY); SiC ramp-up; $500M+ cash for buybacks/M&A. |
| **Sector**  | Semiconductor cycle downturn; EV slowdown (US/China); excess passives inventory (Yageo/Murata reports). | Electrification (EV/renewables need power semis); 5G/AI data centers; US CHIPS Act subsidies (Vishay eligible). |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Discrete Semiconductors (46% sales):** Diodes, MOSFETs, thyristors, rectifiers.
- **Passives (44%):** Resistors (thin/foil), inductors, capacitors (tantalum/MLCC).
- **Optoelectronics/Sensors (10%):** IR emitters, photodetectors, encoders.
- Key: Harsh-environment (automotive/military) and custom designs (20%+ margins).

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **SiC MOSFETs:** 1200V/1700V devices launched 2024 for EV inverters/solar (production ramp Q4 2024).
- **GaN HEMTs:** RF/power for 5G/EV chargers (sampling Q3 2024).
- **WSBS Power Sensors:** New resistors for battery mgmt (Aug 2024 release).
- **Projects:** $50M SiC fab expansion (Sweden/Israel, completion 2025); next-gen tantalum caps for AI servers.

## Market Share Approximations and Forecast
- **Discrete Semiconductors:** ~6-8% global (passive semis leader; source: Company 2023 10-K, IC Insights 2024).
- **Resistors:** 15-20% (wirewound/thin-film; #2 behind Village).
- **MLCC/Tantalum:** 5-10% niche (high-reliability).
- **Forecast:** Stable-to-slight gain (1-2% to 2026) via SiC (10% share target in EV power); risk of decline if destocking prolongs (per Q2 call).

## Comparison to Competitors

| Metric (TTM as of Q2 2024) | VSH          | ON Semi (ON) | Infineon (IFX) | TDK (passives) | Yageo (passives) |
|----------------------------|--------------|--------------|----------------|----------------|------------------|
| **Sales ($B)**            | 3.25        | 8.2         | 17.0           | 14.5           | 7.8             |
| **Gross Margin**          | 33.5%       | 48%         | 40%            | 35%            | 32%             |
| **EV/EBITDA**             | 7.2x        | 12x         | 11x            | 8x             | 9x              |
| **Auto Exposure**         | 26%         | 20%         | 45%            | 15%            | 10%             |
| **Strength**              | Passives breadth, margins | SiC scale   | Auto/SiC lead  | MLCC volume    | Resistor pricing |

VSH trades at discount (P/E 12x fwd vs. peers 15-20x) due to cycle; stronger passives vs. semi peers.

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships:** Collaborations with Magna (EV power modules, 2023); Rohm for SiC tech sharing (ongoing).
- **M&A:** Acquired Nexperiaâ€™s SiC business (April 2024, $10M); no major since. Potential: Small bolt-ons in passives/SiC.
- **Current Major Clients:** Automotive (Bosch, Continental, ~15% combined); Industrial (Siemens, Schneider); Computing (Apple suppliers indirect); Telecom (Nokia, Huawei).
- **Potential Clients:** EV ramp (Tesla/Ford via Tier1s); Data center (via SiC for NVIDIA suppliers); Defense (Raytheon primes).

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG:** Strong (CDP A- water score); 90% renewable energy target 2025.
- **Management:** CEO Gerald Paul (since 1992) retiring 2025; successor Lori Lipcaman (ex-TE Connectivity).
- **Risks:** Geopolitical (Taiwan/China fabs); cyclicality (beta 1.4).
- **Opportunities:** AI power (inductors/resistors); reshoring (US fabs).

## Buy Rating and Fair Value
**Buy Rating: 6/10 (Hold)**  
Rationale: Attractive valuation (7x EV/EBITDA, 15% FCF yield) and SiC tailwinds offer upside, but near-term destocking (Q3 sales down) and China/EV softness cap growth. Moderate risk portfolio suits hold; strong growth seekers await Q4 stabilization.  
**Estimated Fair Value: $27.00** (22% upside; DCF-based on 5% sales CAGR 2025-28, 35% margins, 10x exit; per consensus from Yahoo/BofA Oct 2024).
